name: Gluten-Free Quinoa Noodles
author: kitchenwitch
summary: I made this one up myself when I was really wanting chicken and noodles. It's based on the Betty Crocker® recipe. I use quinoa flour because of the increased nutritional content. Plus, as any GF person knows, we get real tired of the same old stuff constantly, and quinoa has a great flavor.
directions: Mix quinoa flour, 1 cup rice flour, xanthan gum, basil, rosemary, oregano, and salt together in a large bowl; make a well in the center
Whisk eggs and egg yolk together in a small bowl
Mix in water and olive oil
Pour into the well in the flour mixture; mix thoroughly until a dough forms
Lightly dust a work surface with 2 1/2 tablespoons rice flour
Knead dough until smooth and elastic, 8 to 12 minutes
Cover dough and let rest, about 10 minutes
Dust work surface with remaining 2 1/2 tablespoons rice flour
Roll each piece of dough into a square shape that is about 1/16-inch thick
Let dough rest, uncovered, for 20 minutes
Roll each square of dough up loosely; slice into 1/4-inch pieces
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil
Cook noodles until tender yet firm to the bite, about 2 minutes
